user_review: I was a regular customer here before. I had several takeout orders and delivery orders during this pandemic period. I am always happy with the food, the package and the waiting time.My husband's regular choice is the boss, and mine is changing all the time. I like the ones with mushrooms and the spicy chili sauce and pickled pepper.The fries may get a little soft but very good still. The coleslaw is very tasty and crunchy. I like their style.

(Last visited 12/5/2019.) Here in Montréal on business (still) and I've been eating well for the most part, but I had a craving for a nice, juicy burger since I've seen this place while walking around downtown, so let's try it! Here's how it went.Atmosphere/Appearance: This place is quaint and tucked right on Rue Crescent. There is only street parking, so good luck with that. Lol. Once inside you're immediately met with the bar on the right and a line of 2-top/4-top tables that can be pushed together on the left. There's a very "homey" vibe here and I felt comfortable. It reminded me of just like, eating in someone's living room. Then you can go upstairs where there's another bar for the busy days and more seating. I really liked it in here.Service: The first time I came here Adrian took care of me and he was awesome. He took great care of me and made me feel so welcome. The 2nd time I came I got takeout, but was treated with the same respect as if I were dining in.Food: My first time I came I got the Brie & Mushroom AAA Bison Burger. LAWD! It was fantastic. It was so juicy, meaty, savory and just amazing. I upgraded my fries to sweet potato fries and they were too... fantastic. Burger Bar KILLED it. So while I was perusing the menu, I noticed they had wings. Y'all know how I feel about wings, so say no more. 2 days after that burger (likely a Wednesday for Wing Wednesday), I came back and got an order or Buffalo Blue wings as well as their Extra Spicy wings. They were so good! The burger was a bit better, but still the wings were fire FOR SURE. I'd totally come back for them.Value: (All prices are in $CAD.) My burger was $24.00 and to add the sweet potato fries was $3.95. My wings were $16.00 each and you get 10 in an order. Very good value for the quality of food that you get.In conclusion, I LOVED this place and it's easily one of my favorite places in Montréal to eat. I will absolutely come back here when I return for future visits.

Burger Bar Crescent doesn't jump out at you when you're walking down Crescent street, but once you try the burgers there you'll never forget it. I came with a group of ten of my friends. The restaurant is relatively large, with two floors. Usually the second floor of a restaurant lacks ambiance, but we were seated there due to the size of our group and I still loved the atmosphere. Most of us got the hangover burger because, obviously!!?? Just looking at it on the menu made me drool! 6 oz AAA beef patty, American cheese, smoked bacon, mini classic poutine, fried over-easy egg, caramelized onion and truffle oil. I don't know what anything else on the menu tastes like but, based on the hangover burger alone, I would recommend this restaurant to everyone. A great MTL restaurant, perfect for locals and visitors. 5 stars!!

A wonderful burger place! Two floors- second with bar. Many burger options and all looked so good! It was hard to choose just one. I got the supersonic burger which was so good with the spicy mayo . It had just enough kick ! We also ordered the pulled pork poutine - this was so good! We also got the poutine with the smoked meats but I liked the pulled pork better ! We also ordered wings- GENERAL TAO WINGS, SPICY JD BBQ WINGS and BUFFALO BLUE WINGS. I really liked the wings too! This was a great place I would be happy to go back ! There will 11 of us and service was great

Cool Spot.Saw the pics for this place on yelp and had to stop by and tackle one of these big ol burgers.Don't be scared of the sizeI got the hang over burger and it with the onion rings held me over pretty good.Everyone at our table seemed happy and I did not hear any complaints which is rare now days, seems someone always finds something wrong .Our service was good and pretty quick .If I am ever in Montreal again and in the mood for a burger I would come back here .Also I have become a bit of a coffee drinker just the plain house coffee , but they offered many different types when I was ordering.

Got a table for five people on a Friday afternoon four lunch/dinner. Modern interior with wooden tables lining the wall for seating (and somehow not crowded at all).Wasn't necessarily in the mood for a burger, so ended up ordering the Smoked Meat Poutine ($18). A large platter of crisp fries with a thick gravy, cheese curds, smoked meat, and pickles on top. Curds weren't too chewy and the meat/gravy had lots of flavor. Felt like the ratio of curds to the fries and meat were a bit high. Beer list isn't extensive, however it is moderately priced at around $8-9.Server is quick and got our orders in without issue. Hopefully get to try the burgers someday.

If you look closely enough, you'll see a cold brew pumpkin spice latte from Starbucks. That's right, for all you basic bitches, pumpkin spice season has finally started. On a more exciting note, this burger was definitely tricky to eat and yes I made it all happen- well at least half of it lol. This bad boy called The Hangover was the winner of Le Burger Week in the previous year: 6oz of AAA beef patty, American cheese, smoked bacon, fried over-easy egg, caramelized onion, truffle oil (UH. HELLO?‍) and to top it off- a built in poutine tower inside the burger. They got me at poutine and truffle . Trust, this is a nervous tick laughter because I had no idea how I was going to eat this beast. That's right. Forget about your skin tight dress and high waisted jeans. Make sure you go on a water fasting FOR DAYS before you choose to challenge yourself and clog your arteries with this bad boy. I thought I was brave.  Shit we do for the sake of food community.  As you may know, BURGER WEEK STARTS TOMORROW! I'm already starting to feel the regret but don't forget to vote! It makes eating messy burgers a little more fun. THANK YOU BURGER BAR FOR HAVING ME.

A great Burger place! I ordered the Boss burger and onion rings for take-out. Juicy burger with bacon,tomatoes, American cheese topped with a fried egg. Once you have their burgers you won't go anywhere else. They have everything from burgers to poutine to Mac and Cheese and  milkshakes. Whatever your heart desires they have it. Can't wait to sit inside and try the hang-over burger. It's so big that you have to eat in.. bahaha! Love it!

We passed by here just to grab a bite to eat and so my boyfriend could watch some Sunday football. To our surprise they had a burger on the menu that won #1 for Burger Week. I usually don't go for burgers and hesitate due to how they make me feel after BUT this was definitely one of the bets burgers I've had in YEARS. The poutine is also one of the best I had while in Canada and that says a lot. The drinks are good as well. It gets pretty packed so the service isn't as great as it could be but the food and drinks make up for it.

Oh Canada!  They know how to make burgers!Skip the wings - had the General Tso and were sub par. But the Burgers were great. One of a few places off Ste Catherine St to welcome kids  Great service too

You must go here! The food was unbelievably great! We ordered a bacon mushroom burger with fries and an order of pork poutine. Everything was delicious. The service was quick and friendly too. If you are in the mood for a burger, I can't think of a better place to go.

Mac and cheese: the top is delicious, under it is just average Mac n cheese. However this is super filling of course so it might ruin your appetite for the burger.The condiments in my burger were fresh and tasty (grilled red bell pepper, avocado, garlic mayo).However the burger patty (cow meat) was a little dry. I liked the black and white sesame bun. Their fries are not bad.Quite pricey for what you get (burgers) though.

We needed poutine, badly.It was either here or Marche, and since Roots store was nearby we came here. Good choice.Burgers were really good, piled high with good ingredients and expertly cooked. Got the chicken wings to start (blue cheese/buffalo) they were demolished. Fries were very good naked.But the poutine!!! So good. Cheesy, gooey, meaty and salty with a base of delicious fries. We got what we needed here. Will be back here next time in Montreal for sure.Good selection of beers (draft and bottled). It's a bar afterall.

This was our first stop on our trip to Montreal and it was amazing. We came early around 5pm and it wasn't too busy, the waitress was quick and attentive. We ordered the smoked meat poutine and bacon mac and cheese and both were perfect! The mac and cheese was very creamy and cheesy with loads of bacon. Poutine was on point! No complaints here!

Last minute choice on a Friday ended up being the highlight of my day. I went to burger bar with a friend and it was amazingly delicious. I had the mac'n'cheese with bacon which was exquisite and my friend had a burger. One of the most juicy burger I've had. Cocktails was sumptuous and we had some shots to finish the night. Everything was great. We had a kind and friendly waitress who made the experience even more comfortable and personalized.

Burger Bar Cresent.Walkin' down Crescent street? Make a stop @burgerbarcrescent . Location is in the heart of d-town so parking don't even. The decor is ok but you go for the vibez. Price is abit high because of location. Jacky had the salad...NAT!!! Go for any burger such as the "Supersonic", and with Leonard Cohen watchin' over you, you Jacky's are in for a ride.Follow @JackyEatsMTL

We went on a Sunday for a birthday, with the music, people and sports television, the place is super noisy. As for Sunday, they aren't that much people but the service was slow, but the waitress was very nice. We always had to chase after her as simple as asking for the menu to see desert. Since it's a burger place, they have various kinds including vegetarian, which is very appreciated. Depending of the burgers, some are really good and some are bland. Their milkshakes are awesome. Overall it's a fun place with the right crowd, personally I have been there 3 times.

(3.5/5)Great place for a burger, however, a little bit pricey for what it is. The ambiance of the restaurant is really nice. It has a sort of classy but fun look and feel inside. The staff are all friendly too. I got the basic burger with an upgraded side of a poutine. The burger was really good. However, it lacked some sauce or juicy-ness to it. I did order it medium cooked but still felt there wasn't enough juice to it. I wish they added some type of bbq sauce to it for free. Side note, I also requested pickles on the burger and they were deliciously sour (the best kind!). The poutine was really tasty. There was a perfect consistency and ratio between the golden fries, "sauce brun" and cheese curds. I would highly recommend upgrading the side to a poutine!Overall, I would recommend this restaurant for their poutines and ambiance. The burgers are nothing special and can be found at a cheaper price elsewhere.

I really like this place. They have plenty of different burger options, all of them very well made, super tasty and with its own signature. I have had several of them already in the past 3 years, and loved all of them. Today I had the Rocky burger, it has provolone cheese, pepperoni, sauteed onions, mushrooms, green peppers, tomato and lettuce with a AAA 6oz beef patty. Absolutely delicious, how can you go wrong with that.I also had a chocolate milkshake, yummy yummy.
Best Buffalo Mac and Cheese & Pulled pork poutine I've ever had. The house Red Ale and Burboun barrel lemonade were great drink selections as well. Definitely a must try. We'll be back.

Our first meal in Montreal and undeniably one of the best meals of our trip! Based on reviews, we decided to go this place and were not disappointed at all.It was the 7 of us on a Friday afternoon, and were seated right away on a large table on the first floor. They had some really nice outdoor seating as well.We ordered a Poutine and a few burgers and also got some chicken wings. Food was absolutely delicious.Service at this place was excellent as well, and their staff is very warm, welcoming, and attentive!

Holy Burger Heaven! The photos are real depictions of what you'll get when you order from here. On our last day in Montreal, we decided to stop by and grab some lunch. the staff was very friendly. they had outdoor seating as well but we decided to stay inside with the AC as it was 80 degrees outside. this place has two floors which is understandable as the first floor doesn't have many tables. there's a bar on both floors and the bathrooms are upstairs. we ordered mozzarella sticks and i got the boss burger with a side of poutine and the boyfriend got the supersonic burger with a side of sweet potato fries. unfortunately the mozzarella sticks weren't worth getting. definitely regret that decision as they were small and barely filled with cheese. we were hoping for that magical cheese pull but instead got a cheese rip. for the price, they definitely should've been bigger and the cheese pull should've wowed us. the burgers, however, live up to the hype. very monstrous but also very delicious! the poutine was good and still crispy. as was the sweet potato fries. definitely a place i would recommend if one wants to crack open a cold one and enjoy a good burger!

We found this restaurant based on its good reviews, and we were not let down. We tried a variety of dishes and shared them among our table. This included the Yosemite Sam burger, bacon mac and cheese and classic poutine. Everything was terrific for our family of four (two school age children). We had poutine several other times during our visit to the city, and this was the best.We also ended the night with milkshakes, which were also A+. This was one of our favorite finds in Montréal!

Best gourmet burger spot in the city and one of my personal favourites.The spicy wings are also awesome and have a pretty decent kick. I find the spice a bit inconsistent sometimes though, and it sometimes is on the weaker side. Probably 50k shu at its strongest.As for other appetizers, the mac and cheese is pretty good and so are the mozzarella sticks. The calamari is sad but I don't know why you would order that at a burger spot.Burgers are awesome. My go-to is the supersonic. If you prefer chicken, the grilled chicken sandwich is pretty sad (adding large avocado slides on a burger should be illegal, it's not going to stay together), but the fried one is a good pick.  While its not an option on the menu, they will let you build your own burger. Fries aren't too great and a bit bland. The portion is also pretty small. Onion rings are good.

I was in need of a place to watch basketball playoffs on a rainy cold and windy night thus coming to realize I've been missing this spot as a go-to place to watch a game for far too long --- better later than never.Their bar area is a good size with a large screen TV right in the middle of the smooth and clean white and black bar top. It was perfectly air conditioned and had a good vibe going on with a nice mix of out-of-towners plus some locals/regulars (good and friendly banter to boot).Much to my surprise they had some well-priced drinks and excellent bar tenders with which to mix/pour them. A daily $7 special cocktail menu was also on offer, of which this particular night's was Negroni.Marine and Danielle sure know how to create very good ones at that. They even do a trick with the orange peel oil - no spoilers here - you'll have to see for yourself. I was also told that they do the same trick for their old fashioned cocktail (on special Wednesdays). An exception, but a good one to this list of specials is Saturday - when Sangria pitchers are $25 or you can get 5 Coronas for the same deal. Oh, and Sunday they do Bacon Caesars, also at $7 a pop, so perfect for 'brunch day'.If my team wins watching there, I just might become a regular myself. I've had their food on other occasions and it's of high quality and taste. I guess I've now experienced the Bar portion of Burger Bar...

I really enjoyed their Royale burger with cheese along with a side of onion rings. The burgers was packed with flavor and prepped just right. Truly hit the spot. The onion rings were prepped to perfection. No greasy. Perfectly cooked being crispy on the inside and soft and chewy on the inside. I really enjoyed my meal and loved they had some Stewart Black Cherry to accompany my meal.Service was quick and friendly, price-tag was good considering the location.My only gripe was the old fashioned I ordered for happy hour, it was way too strong and I opted to limit alcohol just there.Loved this place, would be back for sure.

In the heart of Downtown Montreal on Crescent st. It was easy making reservations for a party of 10. The restaurant has two floors very compact but great layout. They have daily drink specials, we went on a Wednesday -7$ old fashioned and specials on beer.  I ordered a stout with the hangover burger for 20$, it was gigantic! A burger with poutine, american cheddar and beef and a fried egg (overly cooked). The presentation was incredible. I still had to take out the poutine portion out of the burger to eat it. The fries were dry, not enough sauce. I didn't finish the whole dish. I give the burger quality 3/5. Their dessert menu looked good but I was too ful to eat! if you check in with the yelp app you'll get 50% off dessert! Just a notefor birthdays, if you bring a cake there is a 20$ cake cutting fee.

I have been coming to Burger Bar for years! I used to go to Montreal for alot of conferences and I would have their delicious poutine delivered to me in bed. Absolutely amazing. It's a great restaurant/bar located right on crescent (infamous street). I love sitting on the patio. The service is a bit slow but they are always super friendly. The 2 things I love; The Fried Chicken Salad with Toasted Pecans! The Poutine is amazing. Most people would go to Montreal for la banquise or any other famous Poutine joint. I think those are all over rated. This place does it right! Layering the cheese curds & gravy over the fries. It's perfection. I can't wait to go back!Keep Eating, Angela

As an American, and a burger enthusiast, I'm always looking to try bacon cheeseburgers from almost every establishment I visit. My friend suggested Burger Bar Crescent and we decided to grab it as my last dinner in Montreal. We got sat almost immediately and was greeted by our server. Menu was all in French but luckily, I had my friend translate. I ended up getting the Quebecois - 6oz AAA beef patty, sautéed mushrooms, smoked bacon, Swiss cheese and caramelized onions. Bombbb. However, my friend got the Bacon Mac and Cheese and that stole the show. It was crispy and super cheesey. I wish I had gotten that instead and that says a lot, especially as a burger fan. So I would definitely recommend checking out this spot if you're in Montreal and definitely get the bacon Mac and cheese.

Awesome burgers and fries.  No fountain drinks but do have coke products in bottles for 5.00.  Cramped seating but good service.  Really no parking on crowded and narrow streets.  If you do find parking you have to pay.

This is my favorite burger joint in Montreal that I've been to. Their burgers have been cooked great to my liking every time, they have a nice variety from regular to kind of over the top toppings. Their buns are really amazing, they're super duper soft. I almost want to say their made in house but don't quote me on that. Not only do they have great burgers, but their poutine is really awesome to boot. The gravy is excellent, it stands out to me over other poutine spots in the area.My recommendation is The Boss burger and upgrade the fries to a poutine. Done deal. The chocolate chip cookie desert is good too.

This was my Canadian thanksgiving dinner so to speak. Came here on Monday evening and wasn't packed at all. They have about 15+ beers on tap ranging from $6-$9 I believe. For my starters I had the spicy jack daniel wings. The sauce was good but the chicken overall was straight, bland kind of (a theme with the chicken wings at multiple establishments in Montreal). For my meal I shared/had a few things there: supersonic burger (excellent, tasted like I was eating a Italian sub burger), macaroni n cheese (also excellent), and the poutine (fries here are also pretty darn good, the poutine as a whole was good, but I would just go straight fries here). Overall a great place on a busy street in Montreal. I would definitely be back

As an American I have to say I've been pretty disappointed with most of the burgers I've had in Montreal. I just don't understand why they don't ask what temperature I want my burger cooked, and then cook it to medium well/well done every time. However, Burger Bar DOES ask, and as the first place I've been to that asked (and cooked it to a proper medium rare) they automatically were ahead in my book. I had the poutine burger, which was really impressive to look at and really delicious to eat. The poutine is kind of like a cylinder of french fries fried together with gravy and cheese curds. I was really impressed with how well it stayed together while I ate it (with a fork and knife.) I got it with a salad instead of fries because that seemed more reasonable. Everyone I ate with also said they enjoyed their burgers.Our waitress was super nice although the food came out a bit slowly. We went on a Tuesday or Wednesday night so it wasn't very busy at all. All in all solid burger, and definitely one of the best I've had in the city so far. I'd go back if I were in the area.

My ideal life:Burger bar for breakfastBurger bar for lunchBurger bar for dinnerBurger bar for drunk snackBurger bar for lifeAlso if you find drunk screaming guys to be the finest of entertainment, I recommend sitting outside and observing the bar across the street.
Tried the mac and cheese and wayyyy too much pepper. Service is fine. Prices are a bit more expensive than I remembered. Might have another burger soon to see if it's still good.

This is a great find on a street that has plenty to draw your attention. The location has a such a great feel and our service was not only top notch, but personable. My biggest complaint would be that my stomach is not able to hold all the good stuff on this menu. I was drawn to so many tasty options that I was almost pulled away from ordering a burger, but I mean its literally in the name so how do you not get one right? Best call I made all night. The Bacon and Mac Cheese was calling to me, but had to go with the Poutine. We opted for the Hangover Poutine, which is a tasty piece of work. The egg is next level, plus bacon...yep its amazing. My wife opted for the Jack Daniels Burger and I had to go with the Royale with Cheese. I read some reviews before we went in about how spot their cook was for the burgers and they did not disappoint. Both of our burgers: Spot. ON. Med Rare. We got some solid recommendations on our beer from our server and she kept them coming. One of the better choices we made on our visit and would highly recommend.

I came here last week with a date around 8:30pm. The place was not busy. We were immediately seated and given a menu. I got the firestorm burger and my date ordered the burger with the bacon. I regretted my order after tasting my date's burger. His was quite delicious and would highly recommend it.  The reason I did not like my burger was the sauce. ASK for the 911 sauce on the side!!!! The sauce was pour over the burger and it was overpowering that I barely tasted my burger. Way too spicy. I feel I lost out on tasting a really good burger. Other than the 911 sauce, everything else was good. The fries were delicious. I also got the sangria which was good. The place is pretty pricey though but worth the money. Basically an upscale burger restaurant.Our server was nice and attentive.

Overall: gooooooood food, good vibes, + close to MTL shopping. SERVICE: We arrived earlier in the evening, and was seated immediately. I would say it was a bit slow, and here's why: they had plenty of servers. If I think about it now, they had about 7-9 running around, a few for upstairs, and few for downstairs, and a few bus waiters. But for the first 5 minutes, so many waited walked by us even though we had stopped looking at the menus, and was evidently waiting for someone to take our order. I guess only the waitress for our table is allowed to wait on us? It took a while for her to come... but that's the only negative thing I'll say about service, because as soon as we put in our orders there was nothing wrong with it. FOOD: This part was a bit slow. We ordered 2 Stella's (beer) which came quick, but then the classic poutine took awhile to come. Once the poutine came, we gulped it down. It was good poutine. Nothing outstanding. I would go back for it if I ran out of options during my stay. (If you are going here though, definitely order it. You won't be disappointed. To reiterate, I was neither disappointed nor wowed.) The burgers also took awhile to come...but boy was it WORTH IT. It was a very satisfying burger. You get the choice to choose salad, coleslaw, and fries for sides which is a very good variety. Get the coleslaw if you like them because their's is GOOD. (Although the color is vile....)OVERALL (cont.): Go early in the evening because even though they have two floors their tables are very close together so if you are slightly claustrophobic like me or have a big winter coat like me, then go early. Their burgers are gooooood. Get it. And they also have a lot of poutine variety so if you don't like a good old classic version I'm sure there will be something for you.
Best burger I've ever had. The Cesar Salad was excellent as well with some delicious bacon.Great atmosphere!Waitress was very friendly and gave a great recommendation. Clean restaurant.

I always avoid Crescent for the obvious reasons unless I know the specific restaurants to go to and this is exactly what happened. We came here with the Elite Squad before a show and I was very pleasantly surprised.The place was crowded when I came in. Not really my type of environment as it felt more sport bar-ish and very typical Crescent. I was skeptical at first but after seeing their menu I became more intrigued. The staff was very nice & polite, helpful as I asked if they have gluten free buns and thy went to make sure with the kitchen that they would make me lettuce buns instead since they don't have GF bread. The staff works quite hard and was still smiling the whole time which was nice to see.I took the simplest burger on the menu as I wanted to judge the burger in its purest form without the swag and it was great! Others took some pretty funky ones and they all seemed happy. I don't know if I'd come back, purely because Inavoid Crescent but I totally recommend it if you like burger and you are in the neighborhood :)

I've always heard about bison burgers and read a few reviews that mentioned that this place had it so I decided to drop by during my lunch.This place is located downtown and is between Guy metro and Peel metro so depending on your viewpoint, it might be conveniently located or not conveniently located.I checked the online menu from their website and it indicated that they had five different types of bison burgers so I decided to make the trek from where I work downtown to the restaurant.I went into the restaurant and was asked how many people. I mentioned one and the person asked me if I had a problem sitting at the bar and I mentioned that I didn't. I sat down and was handed a menu. I took a look at the menu and it was different from the online menu as it didn't list any bison burgers.The server asked me if I decided what I wanted and I asked whether they had any bison burgers. I was informed that they didn't   :-(One of the other servers corrected her and mentioned that I could have a bison patty instead of a beef patty for an upcharge. This wasn't mentioned in the menu anywhere (at least I didn't see it). Since I went to this restaurant specifically to try a bison burger, I decided to go for it. This didn't really make any sense to me as to why they didn't offer the bison burgers if they had bison patties since based on my understanding the only difference between a bison burger and a regular beef burger is the dressing with the burger and these are usually "universal" (like tomatoes, onions, caramelized onions, cheese, etc.) which are added or put on specific burgers.I ordered my beer and a burger and decided to swap the beef patty for a bison patty for the upcharge. The restaurant wasn't too crowded but there were people sitting outside in the patio as well as what looked to be a birthday party of maybe 12 people or celebration in another table. Where I work, the lunches are somewhat strict and it took me a few minutes to get there and would take me a few minutes to get back so I was a bit worried by my wait. I checked in on the Yelp app (as well as on Facebook) and noticed on Yelp, they had a special on the dessert.My burger and fries came within 15 minutes. The burger was big and the amount of fries were on the average size. The fries reminded me of the fries served at Five Guys except Five Guys drenches their fries in salt and the fries here were lightly seasoned. In terms of the burger that I had, I was expecting a bit more based on the hype of bison meat but it tasted like a beef burger to me. The burger bun was also very big/thick (a bit too big/thick for my liking for a burger). The fact that they didn't indicate bison burgers on the menu also made me suspect since based on my understanding, the only reason not to offer a bison burger and not have it on the menu is if there isn't any bison patties and if a place does have bison patties and has everything else to make/dress/garnish a beef burger, why don't they serve/advertise bison burgers? In terms of the burger that I had, it was a very good burger but not the best burger that I've had especially at the price that I paid for it.After finishing, I was interested in the dessert option especially with the Yelp 50% check-in deal but looked at my watch and I was running low on time so I decided to ask for my bill.Service-wise, I thought this place was okay but not excellent or good. The wait staff didn't ask me how my meal was during my meal nor did they refill my water when it was empty (not sure if it was because they saw me drinking my beer at the time). Once I finished my beer, my water was refilled without me asking. With the amount of people in the restaurant, I felt that waiting ~15 minutes for my meal was very good. I felt that they should also update their website to show their "new" menu which doesn't include their bison burgers.

What a perfect meal to end our time in Montreal.  It was a bit pricey, but the burgers, fries, and wings were amazing and totally hit the spot.  I will definitely come back to try more.  My only criticism is maybe they could offer other buns besides the ones that have seeds all over them.

Mmmmm deli!  Mushroom burger with a caesar salad.  Perfectly cooked juicy burger, and the baslmic glazed mushrooms make this burger an all-star.  I debated on the side of onion rings or salad, and settled on the salad.  Glad I did.  I was fresh and perfectly dressed.

We got there before it started getting too busy (around 4:45) and got seated and served right away. Our waitress was so friendly and sat and visited with us and told us about about Montreal. It was a really fun atmosphere and the food was awesome!!! We had the Pulled Pork sandwich and the Bison Burger!

Kind of a loud place, it is a bar but there are two levels to the restaurant. Definitely would recommend splitting a burger and maybe an appetizer with a friend unless if you have a big appetite! The shenanigans burger with candied bacon was delicious, and the peach basil sangria was super refreshing!

Everything on the menu sounded so good it was hard to decide. I ended up getting the s'mores milkshake and the panko crusted chicken sandwich. The burgers and sandwiches here are massive! I ate half and took the other half home. They have other flavors of mayo that you can ask for. I got the garlic mayo and it was delicious!

Burger Bar Crescent had a really cool environment for a bite to eat or a drink. We had a group of 9 which meant we had to wait just a bit but our hostess was very nice and accommodating. At the bar, my cousin and I tasted a few beers and settled on their house brewed beer and a cider. Both we really good.After being seated, we ordered a variety of burgers and poutines. The smoked meat poutine was really satisfying and tasted kind of like a pastrami. My blue cheese burger (recommended by our waiter) was sooo tasty. The meat patty was cooked just right, for me, medium-ish. A tiny touch of pink but mostly medium. Juicy and and salted just right. It seemed like a full house that evening so our burgers took a while to come out but they were certainly worth the wait. I chose a side of coleslaw to go with my burger which was a sweet vinaigrette slaw and surprisingly really refreshing and good.We finished off with a fried Mars bar dessert (50% off with a Yelp check in promo). The melty chocolate and crispy outside went really well with the ice cream. My bill was about $55 Canadian dollars which is really fair considering the portion size of the burgers!Service was great and food was awesome! Would definitely come here again!

Good burgers in a convenient, fun location.  My family went here after visiting the Redpath Museum and walking Mount Royal.  We all enjoyed our burgers.  The fries were tasty.  My husband especially liked the vinegar-based cole slaw.  My kids found the root beer that came in bottles enchanting.  The service was attentive, friendly and quick as well.  Restrooms were clean.  So why the 3 stars?  I think we, maybe being from Texas, are accustomed to good burgers.  These were that for sure, but they weren't over the top.  However we are certainly on the minority, and I would not let this review deter you from giving Burger Barca try.Solid hamburger in a good location.

Food is excellent. The burgers are flavourful and juicy and probably one of the best I have had in Montreal. Have tried four from the menu so far and all of them have been really good!! But the Jack Daniels burger is my favourite here. The servers are super helpful in deciding to what to order. The ambience is upbeat and the place is almost always full. Would highly recommend this spot!!

If you like massive burgers and fries, then this is the place for you. If you like cold beer and big burgers and tasty fries, this place is for you. If you like your fries to be covered in gravy and cheese curds, aka poutine, this place is for you. While the poutine here isnt the best, the poutine plus massive burgers are everything you ever could have hoped for and more. The beer selection could use some improvement, so dock a star there. It's also a bit dingy inside, but that's part of the charm.

One of the best burgers I've literally ever had. I ordered the brie and wild mushroom burger with a side of poutine. I'm 100% coming back to try their other stuff. My cousin and I were here with her baby - They were also family/child-friendly.

The Burgers are delicious. I had "The Dude" and have no regrets.  The beer is really good too. They have local and imported beer, in my opinion the local beer is better. If it is summer try to get a table outside, the street view adds to the atmosphere.

Amazing Burgers and More!I have been to this restaurant many times and have never been disappointed. The burgers are done exactly the way you want them. The generous portion of fries are crispy and delicious. The onion rings are good but not a stand out side dish. The mac and cheese is better than homemade.They also have deep fried mars bars (2) to share because after the burgers you will be full. Try the Boss burger that has a fried egg on top! Yum yum!! Service was quick and friendly and they also do take out if you want to take back to the office.tripadvisor.ca/ShowUserR…

Me and friends came out to Montreal for our friends bachelor party.  After hearing that this burger joint was phenomenal we decided to make sure we have our last meal here.  I am so glad that we did.  The food was absolutely amazing.  I definitely ate a lot more than I should've but it was too good to resist. I had a hot and spicy poutine and a delicious burger.  The prices here are very reasonably priced and the portions are pretty decent.  I can definitely guarantee that you won't leave this place still hungry.  One of my my favorites parts of this city was that me and friends got to sit out on the balcony.  It came with a beautiful view and it only got better with a very pleasant staff serving us.  I cannot wait to come back here.

Seriously one of the best burgers I've ever had the pleasure of eating. It was cooked to perfection and had an incredible blend of toppings. The fries were also really tasty. I definitely recommend asking for extra napkins. This will definitely be a spot I return to the next time I'm back in Montreal.

I couldn't come back to Montreal without coming to this place again. This place has a hip vibe to it always playing some cool music. Really a cool atmosphere whether you are going with your buddies, your girlfriend or mistress or as a first date. Their spiked lemonade or whatever they call it is very good. Doesn't taste like it has any booze in it but then you have two or three and your drunker than a Kennedy. I opted to start some wings as despite them being a Burger Bar (hence the name) their wings are top notch. I went with the General Tao wings. General Tao if you don't know led the Canadian army to an upset VICTORY over the hated Russians in the nineteen tickety two grand nationals of hockey. He is a real treasure. The wings are a but pricey but comparable for downtown Montreal. However they are phenomenal they have some spice to them but nothing overhlwhelming. The wings are huge as well and come with green onions on top. They are really good, this place could be a wing bar. After demolishing the wings I knew I needed a burger. Their menu is rich with some traditional burgers but being that I live a boring mundane life I decided to rip it up a bit and opted for "The Dude" which is a combo of beef, veal, and pork. This burger is only offered as well done as it has veal. It came shortly thereafter and it was a beast. The flavor blend is on point. Cooked perfectly and nice and juicy. Their buns not unlike my own is a star on its own. It has what seems like everything bagel seasoning on it. It's very good as is this place thru and thru. This place has a mellow vibe with a hipster feel and food that will leave you in need of a cold shower. Don't be fooled that because it's on Crescent Street that it's a tourist trap it's not, I mean it is but it doesn't mean it's a place to be avoided you are doing yourself a big disservice by not coming here and stuffing your face.

We were quickly seated out on the patio, and a cute little table with a good view of Crescent Street. Service was quick to get water and drinks out to the table.Ordered two burgers, substituted chicken for the 6 ounce patty. Mine was the super hot one with a jalapeño relish, my wife's was chicken with pepper jack cheese and avocado. Both were delicious. Could've used a larger amount of chicken though, considering you pay 3$ upcharge. Overall an excellent dinner experience, with the interesting sights and sounds of the sidewalk.

Went here because Yelp had it as 4 stars. They are wrong. 10 stars. We had the smoked meat poutine, the Québécois burger, and the Firehouse burger. Each was awesome. The server, the hostess and bar staff was great and eager to please despite this being the busy Formula 1 weekend, Highly recommended!!!!

This was our first stop in Montreal and let me tell ya, it did not disappoint. Any place that has a whole section of their menu dedicated to poutine deserves free poutine for the rest of their life. I often don't eat meat and this place is awesome because they give you the option to supplement any meat options with a veggie black bean burger that melts in your mouth. The server was really nice and the vibe here was great. The NFL draft was happening so this was the perfect spot to grab a bite and hang out.

We were visiting the Quebec province specifically Montreal and Quebec City. We had poutine everyday for 6 days. I went to poutine spots recommended by old friends in old town Quebec City, spots recommended by the concierge at our hotel in Quebec City and finally at burger bar. Burger Bar ended up beating everyone!The gravy at the other spots went from undersalted to good to eat oversalted. The fries varied from too soft, over salted and just right. The cheese curds were all pretty good.At burger bar all 3 were great! The fries weren't too greasy or soft, they were nice and crispy with good flavor but not too much to effect the combo of the gravy and fries. The gravy was spot on and add in the curds and this was my fav poutine spot. It's too bad I found it on my last day in Canada

If you're looking for a burger to hit the spot. The. This is it! I was visiting for a conference and I was craving for a good juicy burger. Walked around and just found this gem. My phone was dead, so i couldn't check in or take photos. But mark my words, this place had a great burger, better than some other burger joints I've eaten at. My burger was prepped perfectly, I got the burger called The Boss, which comes with 6 oz. Of AAA beef, good American cheese, bacon and that beautiful fried over easy egg on it. I held the dinon mayo, as I don't like mayo and I threw in some red onions and my goodness; it was so so good that I cut in in quarters just to enjoy it longer, lol. Bite after bite of flavor packed in such goodness.I was greedy with this place, I even got the decadent Poutine which has confit duck and foie grass. This nearly pit me in a food coma; from all it deliciousness and richness.To top it all off, I had a great vanilla milk shake.Over all a good food experience. Staff was very friendly. I will he going back!!!!

Just got back from having lunch here on a rainy Tuesday. Soo good! We had the classic poutine, mac and cheese, and I had the Firestorm burger. I love spicy food, and this burger definitely was. I loved the way the havarti cheese was melted over the patties. Hnnng. The *only* negative was that the tomato slice on the burger was one of those gross, pink out of season tomatoes. Our server was Julie and it was clear she was a pro. I'm from out of town, and I'm sure this isn't uncommon in Montreal, but I was impressed with how effortlessly she switched between perfect English and French.

Came here after the Habs/Flyers game very convenient location to the stadium about 10 min walk. Best burger I've ever had!! So juicy and flavorful. I got the supersonic and we also got the QUEBECOIS. Very good all around. Bacon Mac n cheese and chicken nachos were also good! Wayyyyy to much food to finish. Maybe it's because we also ended up there at the end of happy hour (1pm game). My girlfriend got 5 shots for $20! Beers are decently priced as well!  And of course to top it off we shared a toasted marshmallow chocolate shake. Our server was so sweet, kind and attentive!! Would definitely go back. All you need to know is food is delicious, service is good and atmosphere was nice!

Great service and it was so fun eating on their balcony! We had a Big Bits (?) burger (CAD$25) which contained two fat slices of foie gras! The wine pour was generous and the poutine was gooey and satisfying. I especially loved their homemade garlic mayo that went with everything. A very pleasant place to have a casual meal.

I love burger bar! Their drinks are amazing and so affordable... it's only $2 extra for a double!! You might as well order a double, just saying! They have the best long island iced teas I've ever had! Basically everything is good! The poutines and burgers are amazing! My go to burgers are the supersonic and the brie and mushroom burger. The sweet potato fries are so good and I'm not usually a person who orders sweet potato fries! I recently just tried their chicken wings. These wings are pretty big! There's a lot of meat on there and it does fall off the bone. My only complaint is that some wings have a strong chicken taste. Also the staff is so nice! I will definitely keep coming back!
Disappointed from our visit.Delicious food, central location but awful service. Do yourself a favor and skip this place for somewhere where they respect clients.

Burgers were expensive drinks where normally priced but everything tasted good, you get for what you pay for and the service was great. I ordered the Boss Burger w fries and a local blonde larger beer. It was great but I ended spending 30$

Decent burger joint in downtown core of MontrealGreat selection of beers on tap the burgers are good Try the hangover burger topped with a Quebec poutine Try to get on patio if you can to enjoy nice ambience of Cresent street

Great restaurant! Saw it on "You Gotta Eat Here" so maid it a point to go on my trip to Montreal! Atmosphere was great! Staff was all super friendly and being in a busy area of the city it was so nice to walk around after!Food was delicious!! The only disappointing part was I looked up the menu online before going and they actually didnt have an option available that was listed online (The Captain Nemo sandwich) BUT! The waitress apologized for the differences in menus and recommended another sandwich (Samurai II) which was similar! And it was fantastic! Recommendation was much appreciated!

Burger Bar was one of the first places that caught our eye during our first full day exploring Montreal. It was a sunny, mild day outside, perfect for eating on the second floor balcony overlooking the activity down below. I had the famous hangover burger along with the wings and was beyond stuffed by the time I finished my burger. The poutine burger was nearly impossible to eat, but everything inside - the mini poutine, the egg, smoked bacon - was cooked perfectly according to both, my friend and I. The terrace on the second floor was very cramped and our wings did inexplicably arrive towards the end of the meal, but that's only a minor inconvenience on an otherwise beautiful day with a great meal.

Burger Bar is really fun place to go in the heart of downtown for a really solid burger - They serve the classics but also have some options with their own special twists. They serve burgers , poutine, mac and cheese salad, wings , sandwiches and other classic bar type food but all with elevated quality and ingredients, The portions are huge and the prices are reasonable for the quality and the quantity that you get,  The atmosphere is very laid back, energetic and lively and the servers are always pleasant and attentive. I had their special Autumn spice cider sangria which was really nice , it had the light refreshing feel of summer sangria but the cinnamon and spices inside made it a nice autumn inspired cocktail, I really enjoyed it - not too sweet and not overpowering with the flavours. I ordered the Big blue burger with a side of poutine. The burger was huge , nice balance of meat and toppings , great blue cheese flavour without being overpowering - this is my go to burger , however the JD bbq sauce burger is also really good. The poutine was well made as well, I got a classic poutine they got all 3 elements perfect (tasty thick gravy, well cooked fries to stand up to it crispy on the outside and soft on the inside and squeaky slightly melted cheese curds) - perfection :)  For dessert we had their warm house baked chocolate chip cookie with ice cream , it was rich but very good - definitely better to order this to share though, the portion is pretty big. Great place for a group/friendly hangout or a casual date - this is just a fun , laid back spot serving really great quality burgers and cocktails for mid range prices - You cant go wrong !

I'm from the Boston area. Visited Montreal back in July but here I am, 4 months later, still thinking about how great your burgers are. Not sure if I'll ever find one that tops yours.Hats off to a great restaurant & staff!
The food was delish, absolutely everything and the service was amazing. I highly recommended this place if you want a good burger.

Delicious burgers, relaxed atmosphere and friendly service make this place worth the trip. I had the Yosemite Sam burger with cut fries and spicy mayo and thought all three were above normal.. delicious. The spicy mayo was genuinely spicy, the fries a decent size and a good mix of greasy and crispy and the burger despite its tall size was manageable to eat with my hands and wasn't the usual sloppy mess other burgers often are. The avocado and bacon gave it that extra flavour. Loved it.

I've had the pleasant chance to check this resto out while I was in the area. I ordered the fried calamari, and though it was good, I've had better. I went for the Mr. Personality burger with cheese, and it was quite juicy, but the beef patty was lacking in salt. Lately I've been obsessing with pecan pie and couldn't resist when I saw it on their menu. I used the Yelp 50% coupon (dessert only) and it was worth it. The pie itself wasn't too sweet and it had a hint of Jack Daniels, along with vanilla ice cream. My only issue with the pie was that the crust was very hard to break. My spoon wasn't helping much, I had to use a knife! Service was very quick and friendly.  The only restaurant that I didn't have to ask for a refill for my water, that's how quick they were!

Yummy burgers and fries! It was our first time trying poutine as well - very tasty! Portions are huge. My husband and son both had double chocolate milkshakes. They said they were one of the best milkshakes they'd ever had! My daughter loved the creamsicle cocktail as well. We will definitely return the next time we are in Montréal!
Decent, not bad but not great. We got the bacon mac and cheese, dude burger, and classic poutine. All were pretty average.

Was extremely happy with the food at burger bar! They could take any burger and make it vegetarian, giving myself many options which I loved!Chips were delicious, sweet potato fries were also a winner! Definitely recommend!
I have been to many bars in Montreal.  Nothing feels more like home than when Marine is your bartender at Burger Bar!  She always brings the fun!

The staff were fantastic from the moment we opened the door, and the meal was so good that we asked to visit the kitchen to share our appreciation. We had two bison burgers, the mushroom/Brie (#1 you have to order) and the blue cheese bison burger (still delicious). We started with cheese sticks and apple/bacon soup (om nom). Definitely ask for the dark German beer!The burgers were insanely good. Juicier than you've ever had, you can tell from the flavor that it was never frozen, and you can order them mid rare and they actually get served mid rare!! Fries get cut on location and are blanched to perfection. Even perfectly spiced. I'll keep this short and sweet, service was incredible (mark and marine), the food blew my companions mind (he's only missing China/Australia on his culinary visits list) - and he has a usually expensive pallet and the entire experience was not only memorable but will be quoted until this friendship dies. Skip the apps and grab the Bison Brie burger. You won't be disappointed!

Best place in town. Bartender and bad ass Marine was outstanding. The entire wait staff was baller and busted their butts to make sure everyone was having an awesome time including Marine's partner in crime Danielle. A+++ You girls are the bees knees. Cheers!

This was literally one of the best burgers that I've ever had in my life. We came across this place totally by chance and I'm glad we did. Great buns, sauces, and top quality meat. This was "The Dude" burger with a side order of poutine.

The burger selection, and the applied creativity are fairly astounding in this joint. This place is almost like a fine dining burger place, based purely on the fanciness of the menu :)The food tasted great, the service was friendly and attentive - a definite winner. PSThe milkshake serving containers are a nice touch - kind of like a jar with a handle :)

DisapointingTook the wild shroom burger.First thing you taste from a burger is the bun so that was't a good start. It wasn't crunch nor hot.the mushrooms were descent,there was not enough carmelized onions and lacked of sauce in the burger too. I resquested medium for the pattie, it came medium done, therefore it wasn't jucy,and it wasn't flavorful.The side of fries that came with it, were average and wasn't fresh hot.The price is rather pricy.I would not recommend this place. Go eat at picks,five guys or frite alors instead.

Hands down, this was the best burger I had in Canada. Burger Bar was a nice spot for my friends and I to grab a bite to eat and hangout after sightseeing all day.After looking at the menu, I became torn between selecting the Bacon Mac and Cheese or The Boss Burger. Luckily for me, my friend was in the same predicament so we decided to get both and split them. The Bacon Mac and Cheese was delicious! The cheese was perfectly melted with thick slices of bacon throughout the dish made for the perfect Mac and cheese. Next, the Boss Burger had my friends and I dreaming about it for days lol The burger had a 6oz AAA beef patty, American cheese, an over easy fried egg, bacon, Lettuce, tomato, and a Dijon mustard. Sounds pretty simple, but it was amazing! My other friend got her burger with avocado and it looked even better! The burger was served with french fries.The wait staff were all very friendly and eager to answer any questions or get us whatever we asked for.If I'm ever back in Montréal, this will definitely be on my list again!

The burgers were delicious!! The menu has a huge variety of things to choose from. My partner thinks it's the best burger he has ever had - and he's had a lot of burgers :O) The fries were delicious and perfectly cooked. Great drink selection.

Pretty good burger restaurant downtown. The variety of burgers is important, as well as the sides you can choose (for example the poutine upgrade). Very wide range of drinks too. The taste of the burger was great (I took the supersonic) and that of the fries too. The burger is not particularly big but enough to leave you satisfied. Prices in the higher range.

Hangover poutine was good - liked the wild mushrooms... tasty gravy,  cheese curds, eggs n truffle oil was ok Started with the mac n cheese to share - wife n daughter liked it along with their burgers.

Pleasantly surprised!I judged this place at first. For some reason I had low expectations.However, my burger was wonderful. I ordered the QUÉBÉCOIS medium well with coleslaw (instead of fries).The burger was pretty big. It was juicy and cooked perfectly. The coleslaw was surprisingly very good as well. It was vinegar based with a hint of sweetness. Customer service was great.

Finally FINALLY this bar saved not only my holiday but my belief that Canadians know anything about beer. What drew me to this place was it reputation for having the best burger in all of Montreal. I must confess that, that claim may be true. I had a "Dude". Which consists of a 6 ounce patty (That can be doubled) fried onions, lettuce, tomatoes, mushrooms and spicy ketchup. The true star of this show was the beer and the barmaid Cammilia (If I spelled her name right). Thanks to her, I had the best conversation I've had since I've been on my holiday and I must say that she was terribly easy on the eyes. Because of the beer and conversation, I have to say that this simple, well thought out place is my favorite thus far during my #Montreal holiday

Im in town from Detroit and I was looking for a familiar location. This place is fantastic and the food was awesome! I sat at the bar and Marine took care of me. Service was A+ and she was super fun too!

Everyone had something they liked - two special burgers, one poutine and a roasted veggie salad with panko crusted goat cheese. We all enjoyed our choices and the waitress was kind to my daughter which made it all the better.

LEGIT BURGERS!I went with the Supersonic ($18)6oz AAA beef patty, Jarlsberg cheese, smoked bacon, dill pickle, banana peppers, tomato, spicy mayonnaise, onion rings, and fries on the side.Also splurged for a $5 side of pulled pork.Fries were kinda meh but the sandwich was one of the best burgers I've had in a while, so 5 stars it is!
My favorite restaurant in the entire world hands down.The hangover burger is the most amazing combo of yumminess ever!

My fiancé eats burgers all over when we travel. He said this is in the top 5 burger meals he's ever had and he considers himself a burger expert. I had the lobster mac and cheese. The lobster was a little scarce but the flavor was excellent. The service was great and we had an all around very enjoyable experience.

Cyndy's Bottom Line:  Awesome, tasty burgers here.Great friendly and attentive service.  Great selection of burgers.Good beer selectionThis is what we ate:  ROYALE WITH CHEESE - a 6oz beef patty, with Swiss and cheddar blend, smoked bacon, lettuce, tomato, onion, and Dijon mayonnaise.I had three burgers in mind to order and our waiter recommended the Royale which turned out to be so yummy, delicious with every bite!   The two cheese made the burger so flavorful.  I wished I ordered my burger medium rare because the burger was done a little over medium but it was still delicious.  The tomato slices were generous.  Good amount of thinly sliced red onions.  The smoked bacon added another tasty layer to the burger and top it off with the Dijon mayonnaise so good.  The burger is stacked high so you will need to eat strategically.  You have a choice of hand cut fries or a salad.  I got the fries which were good with the mayonnaise.QUÉBÉCOIS - 6oz beef patty, sauteed wild mushrooms, smoked bacon, Swiss cheese, and caramelized onions.  Hubby enjoyed this burger.  He was so quiet.Definitely be back for another burger!
Watch once upon a time in Mexico and the Johnny Depp scene when he eats the best meal he's had, then and only then will you understand how good the supersonic burger is.

5/5 !!! The food is extremely good ! Honestly is one of the best burger places that I've been to, the service is really good too. The pesto mac and cheese is amazing, definitely gotta try it, the serving of the food is also really nice. For dessert definitely try the fried Mars bar, they are really really food.

This place had a variety of burgers.  I ordered the Supersonic and hubby ordered the Dude.  We shared, as usual, and enjoyed both.  I had my first and only taste of poutine in Montréal.  They were tasty.  Service was ok.  The only negative I had was the calamari.  It was a little chewy for my taste.  But I do recommend for great burgers.

This place is a lively restaurant on the busy Crescent Street. There are lots of choices around here, but this is worth your time. We were hungry for burgers and although I almost got distracted by some other items on their menu like their French onion soup, I held to it and shared the hangover burger with my dinner mate. Of course it is insanely huge, but it actually was really tasty.  Poutine, bacon, a fresh bun, and beef... why not? We had it with a crisp Caesar salad. I did not catch our servers name but she was friendly and quick with bringing out our food.  It did get loud in the restaurant, but it was not obnoxious.  Although the hangover was a bit of a novelty, I would go back for more.
Great vibe and awesome selection of burgers. Kids options were good too. Price was great and staff very friendly!
Phenomenal food. Great service. Completely satisfied. Chill vibes. Grew atmosphere. Clean. Amazing
Make sure to come here hungry!! You will leave more than satisfied. I recommend the "The Boss" burger
Great decor, good service, good prices but the food just isn't that good.I have to say out of all the burger joints in Montreal, this is my least favorite.
All I can say it was a nice local burger / bar joint. Burger was delicious and the service was good.

Excellent burger with onion rings; vegetables with arugula & goat cheese excellent too. We ate outside & waitstaff was very attentive with refreshing our waters, getting ketchup, fixed the orders at the table next to ours quickly, being very pleasant.
Tried the firestorm.Burger was good and the service is excellent as well .Convenient location

Delicious burgers and mac & cheese, well crafted cocktails ($8 old fashioned Wednesday's!), excellent beer selection (Unibroue on draft is very exciting for this American!), and superb service. I'll be back for sure next time I'm in town! Thanks to bartender Marine!

Nestled on a street with many options- Burger bar was perfect for me. Two levels- small yet roomy at the same time. Knowledge bar staff who made great beer recommendations. Went with the Burger bar RED. Went with the BOSS burger ( egg bacon cheese and added balsamic reduction to it - cooked medium ) came out hot, satisfying and went well with my beer. Flat screen tv for sport fans and music playing in background. A nice lunch escape from the Canadian cold. Will be back.
My first destination for food in Montreal and i left my  here. The burger is a bomb!!  We ordered the Dude and I cant wait to come back for the Boss!!!

On the list of "must go", I went. Being a burger fan this was right up my alley. In sum, burger ($16) was fantastic, and I got the poutine upgrade from regular fries ($3.95). Service, lacked. Hence the 4 stars, not 5. I had the "Royale With Cheese". The burger was spiced perfectly and cooked perfectly medium. Meat was hot, cheese melted, and veggies were cool and crisp. It hadn't been sitting under a heat lamp wilting the lettuce. Bacon was good: crispy and not overly salty. The dressing was a type of mayo/grainy mustard-mix... was great. The poutine (it is Montreal after all) was good as well, not overly salty which I find a lot of the gravies are.Service: Initially off to a good start I was seated right away, glass of water and asked for my drink ( a local red ale) which they brought promptly and took my order. After the meal, I waited for them to come around as my glass had one tiny sip left, and I would've liked another. I waited. I was on the patio, there were 10 others, so not like I was hidden away. Restaurant inside was only maybe 60-70% full. Still waiting, looking trying to get the attention of someone. A guy sat next to me, hostess who sat him gave him a water, said the server would be right out. 10-15 min later the guy who had long since put his menu down said 'forget it' and left. I'm still waiting, trying to get the attention of any server.I went inside to the bar and told them I'd like to pay my bill.  Bartender asked if I had everything I needed and I said "no, what I wanted was another beer" and then told her I'll go across the street to get one (Crescent Street has no end of cool places to grab a beer), and informed her of the other table that left because no one came out to the patio in a reasonable time.

Excellent service in that the servers were nice, non-cheesy, and very helpful.  Bilingual.  I had the Quebecois burger which was excellent.  Poutine was tasty, fries were crispy and not soggy.  My wife had a fried chicken sandwich, kids had burgers, mac and cheese, and calamari - all of which was yummy.  Excellent location in the heart of downtown; it was a super quick walk to the Bell Center to watch a Habs game.   My only complaint was that the Burger Bar Red Ale was a little more "watery" than I would have liked in a beer.  I was hoping for something with a little more body.  I'll happily go back.

Burger Bar Crescent is a fantastic dining option in downtown Montreal. Their various takes on a classic dinner item are not only creative but delicious as well. From their simple bacon and cheddar burger, to their roasted red pepper and avocado, to their Hangover burger which is topped with a fried egg and poutine all of their options are fantastic. I'll definitely be coming back the next time I'm in the city.
We got the Jack Daniels spicy BBQ wings, Rocky burger, BBQ pulled pork sandwich, and smoked meat poutine. ALL were very good. Lots of flavor. The wings were my fav. I'd eat those wings all day.

Very tasty and has vegetarian options. Great service in both languages. We had some sort of weird bachelor party going on when we were there and it was nothing but entertaining. A really great option for a buger and a beer/cider.

This is our second time attending and exactly a year later from the first time.  We booked a reservation even though it was only a Tuesday night, but we are smart enough to know that this place is always busy!  Being creatures of habit we both got the exact same thing as last year because it was just so good.  The crispy chicken sandwich had a sauce with quite the kick to it, and the crust on the chicken was perfectly spiced as well!  The fries are cooked to perfection and go so well dipped in the garlic mayo (only $1 more!!).  The bacon Mac and Cheese is to die for!  It has two big pieces of bacon on top and then coated with panko and cheese that's super ooey and gooey.  Bacon is then spread out throughout the  dish and the cheese sauce is so creamy and cheesy it's irresistible.  We also shared the peach and basil sangria pitcher which is delicious and refreshing.  We finished our meal with a dessert since we had 50% off for checking in on yelp, and although we wanted the s'mores we were told that the menu is misleading and it's actually a cheesecake, so don't get your hopes up.  We then changed our mind and got the cookies and ice cream.  It was a good thing we switched because I have never had a softer and chocolatey cookie in my life!!  Overall, it was an incredible experience again with a lovely staff and atmosphere!  Most likely will come again this time next year and get the same thing yet again!

The best place on go on dates at! I always go with my girlfriend and we always enjoy the burgers there. The many variations of burgers will always leave you satisfied no matter which one you take. As a side, do your self a favor and take the coleslaw, holy cow do I love it! The staff has always been friendly and has great atmosphere, whether inside or out.Beers and cocktail selection is pretty good and gets the job done. Only down side would be there price, but even then you pay for what you get; and what you get is GREAT!

Not to be missed. On a cold -24C day in Montreal we stumbled into this oasis... the peach sangria was fab... the burger waz great... and even the resident vegetsian scored big with a black bean mushroom burger. The pecan pie was amazing. The staff was pleasant and accommodating.  Really a great spot... we will visit again.

I recently went to Burger Bar for lunch on a girl's weekend in Montreal.  The restaurant was recommended to us by our hotel concierge since we were staying in the downtown area and wanted some place close for lunch that had good poutine.  Burger Bar is in the heart of downtown.  It was pretty busy for a Monday lunch.  We ordered the traditional poutine which was delicious -  I wish it had been a bigger serving.  We also all got burgers - their burgers are incredible, huge and they have at least 10+ different versions.  It was on the best burgers I had in a while.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant for anyone who is looking for a tasty burger.
Wow! The Royale With Cheese burger was amazing. Local beer was really nice. Will be back to the Burger Bar for sure.
Buffalo chicken Mac and cheese is a must! It was so yummy. Veggie burger was a little messy, but still very good. Great service too.

Just got to town and needed somewhere to grab a good hut inexpensive dinner. Waitresses spoke excellent English and seated us immediately. Service was prompt and polite and food came out delicious and quick! We ate outside on the balcony patio and were thrilled with being able to eat while watching downtown life. Very pleased with our visit! Definitely recommend!

I could shout it from the hill tops. What a burger!! (Or two in this case)Visiting Montreal with the wife. Usual debate raging about which restaurants to hit up, which of the the old favorites we can't afford to miss, and what new spots to try. This place is close to the hotel we were staying and the subject of many good reviews so hopefully I'll have something to add.The ambience: casual, friendly, warm. Basic wooden table and chairs arrangement with brick wall and some prints on the walls. We were seated at a window seat by our server Mark. He was awesome. Friendly, engaging, and full of suggestions. Perfect service.Skipped appetizers and ordered some tap water and a coke to go with my burger. (Old school style)Burger 1: Foie Gras with caramelized onions and mushrooms. Amazing. The Caramel richness coupled with the juicy patty (which was cooked medium -ish and tasted perfect) was perfectly complimented by the onions and mushrooms. This was my favouriteBurger 2: The Firestorm burger. Hot hot hot!! But flavourful and not too much heat where you can't enjoy it. The jalapeño, banana peppers, and spicy sauce go great with the flavourful patty. For Le piece de resistance I added a fried egg to my burger. Wow! If you don't mind a bit of heat you can't go wrong with this burger.The Sides:Cole slaw: vinegar based, light, refreshing, tasty. Enjoyed by us both even the wife who doesn't particularly care for slawPoutin: no complaints. Came out a bit cooler than I'd like but otherwise fine. We barely ate it since the burgers are so big.Conclusion: premium burgers. Reasonable prices. Casual, friendly setting with great service and a good turn around time. This is exactly what it needs to be - a fun, messy, tasty experience enjoying a burger.

This was my first time trying poutine and so I don't know if it was authentic or not. I didn't care for the gravy. Other than that it was tasty, but I think I'd rather eat a Burger. My requests to sit someplace other than the noisy bar were not honored, so I guess the customer is not always right. The staff seemed nice, but did not care if I was miserable or not. So, I ended up taking it to go after only a couple bites. Not really a great impression for my first restaurant meal in Montreal.

Loved this place!  One of our favorite meals in Montreal.  The service was excellent!  Amazing burgers and poutin!  The bacon Mac and cheese was also to die for!  The s'mores cheesecake was the perfect ending to a delicious meal!  Cute place on the busy Crescent Street scene nestled between many larger and more touristy places.

Edited since we went back a second time. The service on Friday night was excellent and the Stellar onion rings. Fabulous sweet potato fries. Service was great. I got a bison burger and my friend got the BBQ burger. Mine was a wee bit rarer than I usually eat at the recommendation of the server. I think I will stick with well done next time. But, it was still pretty darn good. Would most definitely go

Delicious burgers!  One of the best burgers I've ever had.  I ordered the Royale with cheese and chose the lettuce wrap option instead of the bun.  My bf ordered the Yosemite Sam and both were awesome.  Cooked to perfection with great flavors on both.  I personally liked the Royale better and highly recommend that.  In addition to the delish burgers, the fries are on point too- perfectly crispy just the way I like it. The burgers are a tad bit pricey, but for that location (near all the shops, and other bars and restaurants) plus great service I think it was worth it.

The food was awesome and so filling, we took home more than half of each dish. The chicken burger had 4, yes 4 chicken patties (now you can see why so much was leftover) chicken was flavoured well with just a tinge of spicy taste.Hangover poutine had bacon, eggs, mushrooms in it and was extremely filling.The service was exceptional, restaurant was busy but yet the servers were always around asking if everything is okay and topping up the water. Everyone was pleasant and easy going.Prices are a bit on the higher side but the ambience and food make up for it.

Our first stop at Montreal and wanted something quick but hearty. Decided to give it a try. The service was great and quick (we came at 3:30pm). We ordered a salad, poutine and wings to share, and a couple cocktails. The food was good and the drinks are good.
I liked the place. Too many options to satisfy your taste buds. A bit pricy but it's worth the atmosphere, service and food. Must try for everyone.

Nice place. I opted for the shroom burger with a black bean patty and my hubby opted the Dude burger. My burger is full of flavor, nicely grilled mushrooms (different kinds), and the black bean patty is so good (great gal or, texture and full of beans). My hubby tried the chicken wings ($1 for one during happy hour) and he loves both the wings and the burger. Nice service as well. They don't have a dessert menu and you need to ask the waiter or waitress.
Awesome burgers tables are super closes and if you have a loud neighbor like we did it  almost impossible to carry a conversation but the food and service almost make up for it.

Not from the city so we found this place from Yelp! This place is fantastic! The food was fresh, it came at a good time,we didn't have to wait long. The service was superb!  We had I believe his name was Ben! He was great with us, he was funny and sarcastic, we def enjoyed him as our waiter. All the staff worked together, helped each other out with other tables and refilling waters, they seemed like a good team. I had the special they had which was called "Super nova Crunch" which was a chicken breast coated in a panko crumb, with Cheese, this sauce that he claimed was better than mac sauce (it was pretty good), tomatoes, Lettuce, and 2 big thick slices of bacon. Omf it was delicious.  You'll def leave there full. I thought my burger was big, but I seen some other burgers other customers had order and they're even bigger. Thank you so much guys! It was great! Hope I can come back soon!
Great place, great service, priced right for what you get. Large menu with many options, great place for lunch.

Came during burger week on a Wednesday @ 930p and sat on the balcony. Service was friendly and the mixed drinks were delicious. Stilletto drink (Bourbon with lemonade) was superb. Ordered the classic poutine which was a nice small portion. The gravy was so good & they give you plenty of it. The hangover burger eith poutine was probably not necessary since we just had poutine but we couldn't resist seeing how big it was. The dude burger with fried onions was also delicious. Service, drinks and food was really great. Try to sit on the balcony of you can.

Really good burger! Their drink menu is surprisingly large, and their burgers all look awesome! A variety of options and combinations as well as plenty of choices for those that aren't burger lovers. Service was quick and friendly, we had a nice meal.
The food came quickly, made with fresh ingredients & was delicious! The service was good & the food was up quickly. Would definitely return/recommend.
The hamburgers are amazing, I had the most wonderful service and if you love milkshakes, those ones are to die for! I even had two milkshakes, that's how good they were!!

Such a wide variety of creative burgers, and seemingly all of them very good (everyone in my group was happy). You should be prepared to abandon all pretence of clean, proper eating, though - the burgers are quite tall and juices are running everywhere - so keep your visit for meals with friends. Sangria was lovely, service was friendly!
This is the dude Burger.   It is awesome and just get the egg on it and don't ask questions.   You'll love it.  Wash it down with a maudite.  You will not be disappointed
We walked over a mile to get here and it was worth every single bite!!!! I had the veggie burger and my husband had their classic burger!!! Both were delicious!!!!

While traveling in Montreal my friends and I were trying to find a place to have dinner when we stumbled upon Burger Bar Crescent  and let me tell you it was the best thing that happened to us on our trip (I mean food wise of course). This place serves THE BEST burgers I have ever had in my life. The staff there was amazing! So friendly, accommodating, and welcoming. Not to mention our waitress in particular was the best (shout out to Marine- if you go here and she is working definitely request her). My husband has a lot of food allergies so sometimes it is a struggle for him to eat at certain restaurant. But not here, Marine made sure that his meal was accommodated to his allergies and that it was not lacking in quality or quantity either. Marine really went above and beyond in her service to make sure everything was allergy friendly for him and he had enough options to switch out if he couldn't have what was normally offered with his meal (if you are her boss and reading this please let Marine know that her Boston friends with a lot of allergies give her a shout out and please let her know how awesome she is!) If you like bison burgers I highly recommend the Blue Candy Bison Burger, it was so juicy and the flavors together were out of this world! My friend also really enjoyed the shenanigans burger. Not only was the food amazing but the drinks were just as good. So if you are looking for a great place to eat with a fun atmosphere, amazing food, good drinks, and somewhere to spend your night look no further because Burger Bar Crescent is THE place to go!!!

Ordered the Blue Burger and the Spicy Poutine, and both were fantastic.  The beef patty was thick, soft, and cooked exactly as I had requested.  The burger came stacked at about 10 inches so it took me a while to crunch the numbers and figure out how I was going to eat it, but once I figured it out all the flavors came together nicely and probably ranks in my Top 5 all-time best burgers.

Well, I do not understand how this place could be rated so high. My wife and I had two of the worst burgers we ever had. Not cooked well and lacked any flavor. French fries were decent and waiter was nice but save your money. Not cheap.

I went here for a late lunch on Saturday and the place was packed. Several times they turned people away for lack of tables. The service was terribly slow. 30 minutes before they took my order for food or drink. Another 30 for the food to come. The poor guy next to me at the bar ordered at the same time but had to wait a full 50 minutes for his chicken burger. The menu looks amazing, but they didn't have my first choice. I ended up with the Royal With Cheese and was very disappointed. The patty was dry and the other ingredients were unexciting. The fries were limp.I won't be going back to pay nearly $20 for an average burger and lousy service.
